items.label: openReadableFile(string path)(ballerina/io:ReadableByteChannel)
items.documentation: Retrieves a ReadableByteChannel from a given file path.

items.label: openWritableFile(string path, boolean append = false)(ballerina/io:WritableByteChannel)
items.documentation: Retrieves a WritableByteChannel from a given file path.

items.label: createReadableChannel(byte[] content)(ballerina/io:ReadableByteChannel)
items.documentation: Creates an in-memory channel which will reference stream of bytes.

items.label: openReadableCsvFile(string path, ,|	|: fieldSeparator = ,, string charset = UTF-8, int skipHeaders = 0)(ballerina/io:ReadableCSVChannel)
items.documentation: Retrieves a readable CSV channel from a give file path.

items.label: openWritableCsvFile(string path, ,|	|: fieldSeparator = ,, string charset = UTF-8, int skipHeaders = 0)(ballerina/io:WritableCSVChannel)
items.documentation: Retrieves a writable CSV channel from a give file path.

items.label: print()
items.documentation: Prints `any` or `error` value(s) to the STDOUT.

items.label: println()
items.documentation: Prints `any` or `error` value(s) to the STDOUT followed by a new line.

items.label: sprintf(string format)(string)
items.documentation:
Returns a formatted string using the specified format string and arguments. Following format specifiers are allowed.
   b              boolean
   B              boolean (ALL_CAPS)
   d              int
   f              float
   x              hex
   X              HEX (ALL_CAPS)
   s              string (This specifier is applicable for any of the supported types in Ballerina.
                  These values will be converted to their string representation.)

items.label: readln(any a)(string)
items.documentation: Returns the input read from STDIN.

items.label: ReadableByteChannel
items.documentation: ReadableByteChannel represents an input resource (i.e file, socket). which could be used to source bytes.

items.label: ReadableCharacterChannel
items.documentation: Represents a channel which could be used to read characters through a given ReadableByteChannel.

items.label: ReadableCSVChannel
items.documentation: Represents a ReadableCSVChannel which could be used to read records from CSV file.

items.label: ReadableDataChannel
items.documentation: Represents a data channel for reading data.

items.label: ReadableTextRecordChannel
items.documentation: Represents a channel which will allow to read

items.label: StringReader
items.documentation: Represents a reader which will wrap string content as a channel.

items.label: WritableByteChannel
items.documentation: WritableByteChannel represents an output resource (i.e file, socket). which could be used to sink bytes.

items.label: WritableCharacterChannel
items.documentation: Represents a channel which could be used to write characters through a given WritableCharacterChannel.

items.label: WritableCSVChannel
items.documentation: Represents a WritableCSVChannel which could be used to write records from CSV file.

items.label: WritableDataChannel
items.documentation: Represents a WritableDataChannel for writing data.

items.label: WritableTextRecordChannel
items.documentation: Represents a channel which will allow to write records through a given WritableCharacterChannel.

items.label: Format
items.documentation:
Format which will be used to represent the CSV.

DEFAULT - Would default to the format specified by CSVChannel. Presidence will be given to field
          separator and record separator.

CSV - Field separator would be "," and the record separator would be new line.

TDF - Field separator will be tab and record separator will be new line.

items.label: Separator
items.documentation: Field separators which are supported by DelimitedTextRecordChannel.

items.label: ByteOrder
items.documentation:
Represents network byte order.

BIG_ENDIAN - specifies the bytes to be in the order of most significant byte first

LITTLE_ENDIAN - specifies the byte order to be the least significant byte first
